summary: The Offshore Energy Modernization Act of 2025 aims to support the responsible development of offshore renewable energy projects. It sets national goals for offshore wind energy production, amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to encourage responsible development, establishes an Offshore Power Administration, and provides funding for environmental and cultural reviews. Key provisions address permitting, compensation for impacts, transmission infrastructure, shipbuilding, and access to offshore renewable energy areas, focusing on promoting clean energy and mitigating potential negative impacts on stakeholders.
